verses.kjv: And when Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister; and said unto Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.
verses.ct: When Rachel realized she had not given Jacob any children, she became jealous of her sister. She told Jacob, "Give me children, or I will die."

verses.kjv: And Jacob’s anger was kindled against Rachel: and he said, Am I in God’s stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
verses.ct: Jacob became angry with Rachel and replied, "Am I in the place of God, who has kept you from having children?"

verses.kjv: And she said, Behold my maid Bilhah, go in unto her; and she shall bear upon my knees, that I may also have children by her.
verses.ct: She said, "Here is my servant Bilhah. Sleep with her so that she can bear children on my behalf, and through her I too can have a family."

verses.kjv: And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid to wife: and Jacob went in unto her.
verses.ct: So she gave him her servant Bilhah as a wife, and Jacob slept with her.

verses.kjv: And Bilhah conceived, and bare Jacob a son.
verses.ct: Bilhah became pregnant and gave birth to a son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Rachel said, God hath judged me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a son: therefore called she his name Dan.
verses.ct: Rachel said, "God has judged in my favor. He has also listened to my plea and given me a son." So she named him Dan.

verses.kjv: And Bilhah Rachel’s maid conceived again, and bare Jacob a second son.
verses.ct: Bilhah, Rachel's servant, became pregnant again and gave birth to a second son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Rachel said, With great wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.
verses.ct: Rachel said, "I have struggled intensely with my sister, and I have won." So she named him Naphtali.

verses.kjv: When Leah saw that she had left bearing, she took Zilpah her maid, and gave her Jacob to wife.
verses.ct: When Leah saw that she had stopped having children, she took her servant Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as a wife.

verses.kjv: And Zilpah Leah’s maid bare Jacob a son.
verses.ct: Zilpah, Leah's servant, gave birth to a son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, A troop cometh: and she called his name Gad.
verses.ct: Leah said, "Good fortune has arrived!" So she named him Gad.

verses.kjv: And Zilpah Leah’s maid bare Jacob a second son.
verses.ct: Zilpah, Leah's servant, gave birth to a second son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, Happy am I, for the daughters will call me blessed: and she called his name Asher.
verses.ct: Leah said, "How happy I am! Women will call me blessed." So she named him Asher.

verses.kjv: And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son’s mandrakes.
verses.ct: During the wheat harvest, Reuben went out and discovered mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, "Please give me some of your son's mandrakes."

verses.kjv: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my husband? and wouldest thou take away my son’s mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to night for thy son’s mandrakes.
verses.ct: Leah replied, "Isn't it enough that you have taken my husband? Now you want to take my son's mandrakes too?" Rachel answered, "Then he will lie with you tonight in exchange for your son's mandrakes."

verses.kjv: And Jacob came out of the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, Thou must come in unto me; for surely I have hired thee with my son’s mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.
verses.ct: When Jacob came in from the field that evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, "You must come to me tonight, because I have paid for you with my son's mandrakes." So he lay with her that night.

verses.kjv: And God hearkened unto Leah, and she conceived, and bare Jacob the fifth son.
verses.ct: God listened to Leah, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a fifth son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, God hath given me my hire, because I have given my maiden to my husband: and she called his name Issachar.
verses.ct: Leah said, "God has rewarded me for giving my servant to my husband." So she named him Issachar.

verses.kjv: And Leah conceived again, and bare Jacob the sixth son.
verses.ct: Leah became pregnant once more and gave birth to a sixth son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, God hath endued me with a good dowry; now will my husband dwell with me, because I have born him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.
verses.ct: Leah said, "God has presented me with a precious gift. Now my husband will honor me, because I have given him six sons." So she named him Zebulun.

verses.kjv: And afterwards she bare a daughter, and called her name Dinah.
verses.ct: Later she gave birth to a daughter and named her Dinah.

verses.kjv: And God remembered Rachel, and God hearkened to her, and opened her womb.
verses.ct: Then God remembered Rachel. God listened to her and opened her womb.

verses.kjv: And she conceived, and bare a son; and said, God hath taken away my reproach:
verses.ct: She became pregnant and gave birth to a son, saying, "God has removed my disgrace."

verses.kjv: And she called his name Joseph; and said, The LORD shall add to me another son.
verses.ct: She named him Joseph, saying, "May the LORD give me yet another son."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Rachel had born Joseph, that Jacob said unto Laban, Send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and to my country.
verses.ct: After Rachel had given birth to Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, "Let me leave so I can return to my own homeland."

verses.kjv: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my service which I have done thee.
verses.ct: "Give me my wives and children, for whom I have worked for you, and let me go. You know well how hard I have labored for you."

verses.kjv: And Laban said unto him, I pray thee, if I have found favour in thine eyes, tarry: for I have learned by experience that the LORD hath blessed me for thy sake.
verses.ct: Laban replied, "Please, if I have found favor in your sight, stay. I have discovered through experience that the LORD has blessed me because of you."

verses.kjv: And he said, Appoint me thy wages, and I will give it.
verses.ct: He continued, "Name your wages, and I will pay them."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee, and how thy cattle was with me.
verses.ct: Jacob told him, "You are aware of how I have served you and how your livestock have thrived under my care."

verses.kjv: For it was little which thou hadst before I came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and the LORD hath blessed thee since my coming: and now when shall I provide for mine own house also?
verses.ct: "What you owned before I arrived was very little, but now it has grown enormously. The LORD has blessed you wherever I turned. But when will I be able to provide for my own household?"

verses.kjv: And he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob said, Thou shalt not give me any thing: if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again feed and keep thy flock.
verses.ct: Laban asked, "What should I give you?" Jacob answered, "You don't need to give me anything. Just do this one thing for me, and I will continue tending and watching over your flock."

verses.kjv: I will pass through all thy flock to day, removing from thence all the speckled and spotted cattle, and all the brown cattle among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats: and of such shall be my hire.
verses.ct: "Let me go through your entire flock today and remove every speckled and spotted animal from the cattle, every dark-colored one among the sheep, and every spotted and speckled one among the goats. These will serve as my wages."

verses.kjv: So shall my righteousness answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my hire before thy face: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be counted stolen with me.
verses.ct: "My righteousness will testify for me in the future, whenever you come to inspect my wages: any goat that is not speckled or spotted, and any sheep that is not dark-colored, you may consider stolen if found with me."

verses.kjv: And Laban said, Behold, I would it might be according to thy word.
verses.ct: Laban said, "Agreed! Let it be exactly as you have proposed."

verses.kjv: And he removed that day the he goats that were ringstraked and spotted, and all the she goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.
verses.ct: But that very day, Laban removed all the male goats that were streaked and spotted, all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had any white on it, and all the dark-colored sheep, and placed them in the care of his sons.

verses.kjv: And he set three days’ journey betwixt himself and Jacob: and Jacob fed the rest of Laban’s flocks.
verses.ct: Then he put a distance of three days' travel between himself and Jacob. Jacob continued to tend the rest of Laban's flocks.

verses.kjv: And Jacob took him rods of green poplar, and of the hazel and chestnut tree; and pilled white strakes in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.
verses.ct: Jacob took fresh branches from poplar, almond, and plane trees, and peeled strips of bark from them, exposing the white wood underneath.

verses.kjv: And he set the rods which he had pilled before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink.
verses.ct: He placed these peeled branches in the watering troughs where the flocks came to drink, right in front of them, so that the animals would mate when they came to drink.

verses.kjv: And the flocks conceived before the rods, and brought forth cattle ringstraked, speckled, and spotted.
verses.ct: The flocks mated in front of the branches and produced offspring that were streaked, speckled, and spotted.

verses.kjv: And Jacob did separate the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the ringstraked, and all the brown in the flock of Laban; and he put his own flocks by themselves, and put them not unto Laban’s cattle.
verses.ct: Jacob separated these lambs and directed the flocks to face toward the streaked and dark-colored animals in Laban's flock. He kept his own animals apart and did not mix them with Laban's livestock.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger cattle did conceive, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the cattle in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods.
verses.ct: Whenever the stronger animals were mating, Jacob would place the branches in the troughs right before their eyes so they would breed near the branches.

verses.kjv: But when the cattle were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were Laban’s, and the stronger Jacob’s.
verses.ct: But when the weaker animals were mating, he did not put the branches there. So the weaker ones went to Laban and the stronger ones to Jacob.

verses.kjv: And the man increased exceedingly, and had much cattle, and maidservants, and menservants, and camels, and asses.
verses.ct: In this way, Jacob grew extremely prosperous. He acquired large flocks, female and male servants, camels, and donkeys.
